name: Ibis Berlin Mitte

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ibis Mitte Hotel in Berlin for 7 nights in March 2006. Spotlessly clean, quiet and very convenient. We used the superette at the gas station next door for snacks...which I had not read about beforehand.
reviews.title: just what we needed in a hotel

reviews.text: The trolley is just outside the door, and the underground subway is 2 blocks away...as is a full grocery store.
reviews.title: No problems at all
Best deal - fine place
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in December 2004. We also took advantage of the 49 euro deal and it was great value for money considering that it is not much more than a private hostel room. Our double room on the 6th floor was spacious and clean. As you walk in there is a hanging rack and shelving unit, and then there is another door opening into the bedroom. This was useful in keeping out the sound of other guests walking along the corridoor. The bathroom was standard size, very clean, though it could have done with a better fan to get rid of the steam.

There is a bar behind the reception desk, and though we didn't have a drink there, the prices were cheap and they also serve snacks like soups and nachos. The people at reception were very friendly and helpful, and kept the free apples and sweets at the front desk well stocked. We passed on the 9 euro breakfast and bought heated rolls and fruit from the petrol station next door - there are small tables where you can eat standing up, italian style.
reviews.title: very good value
Nice hotel, good location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ibis Mitte for 3 nights at the start of December 2003.

description: Tourists love the 2-star Ibis Berlin Mitte. The hotel is located in the center of the German capital and is ideal for sightseeing or clubbing. Alexanderplatz is only 5 minutes' walk away and from there you can catch a bus or train 24 hours a day.
